questions.question: I hope he ……………………………. the plane tickets.
questions.description: After I hope we use a present tense with a  future meaning.

questions.question: The forest was so dense we ………………………….. see through the trees.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: You will have to pay a fine if you ……………………………. to keep the appointment.
questions.description: In the first conditional we use a simple present tense in the if clause and will + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: She forfeited the match when she …………………………… to play.
He brought ……………………………. a proposition that we all liked.
questions.description: Forth means onward or forward in space.

questions.question: He is quite close to several members of the ………………………… estate.
The lawyer was ………………………….. a police officer.
She ………………………….. since she dropped the skillet on her foot.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: We caught only a ……………………………. glimpse of the royal cavalcade.
………………………… I love Sundays!
questions.description: When how is used in exclamations, the verb comes after the subject.

questions.question: The train …………………………. at half past six.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about future events that are part of a time table.

questions.question: Red color does not ………………………. me.
questions.description: Suit refers to style and color. Fit refers to size and shape.
